title: How to Play the Nintendo Wii and Love It

steps.headline: Put on the wrist strap.
steps.description: This will keep the Wii Remote from falling out of your hand and injuring yourself or those around you. It should also prevent you from damaging your television screen with the Wii Remote.

steps.headline: Place the Wii in an open area.
steps.description: The Wii is a common console to get overheated if there is not enough ventilation available.

steps.headline: Stand at least 5–8 feet (1.5–2.4 m) away from the screen.
steps.description: This will decrease your chances of damaging the screen, and the pointing feature of the Wii Remote will work better.

steps.headline: Insert a game into the Wii and turn it on.
steps.description: The light on the side should turn green.

steps.headline: Use the Wii Remote the same way you would use a television remote, by pointing to the desired object on the screen and pressing A.

The light on the side should turn green. Use the Wii Remote the same way you would use a television remote, by pointing to the desired object on the screen and pressing A.
